result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce A Handel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 07/01/16 or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. No Huber privileges. Court objects to ES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce A Handel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  25 days HOC, consecutive.  Due & owing
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Arlo Z. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212618 in court 1x on 7/1/15.
Defendant's motion or request for release privileges is denied by the Court.  The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for school release.
Witness fee request prepared for ARLO, Z. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Court signed petition for return of property of the Vizio 48 in flat screen TV to the victim.  copies given to all parties. lr

Defendant Bruce A Handel in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Bruce A Handel in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve FIVE MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for ZERO days time served.  No Huber privileges . Court objects to ES. 

Court ordered all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges  to be paid by 7-1-16 or serve 25 consecutive  days in the House of Correction.

Court will grant  expungement if defendant pays the mandatory fees ,  costs and  surcharges and successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Defense filed motion in limine and proposed jury instructions. lr
State filed notice of motion in limine;witness list and proposed jury instructions.
Defendant Bruce A Handel in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains on for jury trial.

Defendant Bruce A Handel in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 07-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ARTHUR H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bruce A Handel in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Bruce A Handel in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
